alert.note: Alert for West Polk (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 09 at 8:01AM CST until November 09 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory this morning , freezing rain. Ice accumulations of a light glaze to one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Watch tonight, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, with potential for small areas of higher amounts and ice accumulations of around two tenths of an inch possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...In Minnesota, West Polk County. In North Dakota, Nelson and Grand Forks Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late tonight through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...For the advisory this morning, slick travel conditions are expected during the morning commute. For the watch, travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After the period of freezing rain this morning there should be a lull in winter impacts through early evening. For the watch period, uncertainty remains for the areas that could receive the heaviest snow and timing and coverage of freezing rain or sleet. This will create large spread in potential impacts, and the storm track could still shift.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
